thread.title: Is this Manchester City's new home kit for the 2016-17 season?
thread.title_full: Is this Manchester City's new home kit for the 2016-17 season?

author: Stuart Brennan
title: Is this Manchester City's new home kit for the 2016-17 season?
text:
Is this the kit Manchester City will be wearing next season? (Photo: www.footyheadlines.com / Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester City's new home kit for next season appears to have been leaked. 
Football website Footy Headlines claims to have obtained an image of the jersey, which carries a classic design. 
The dark blue sleeves of this season have been scrapped in favour of a lighter blue, the Manchester Evening News report. 
The full kit also reveals a nod to history that is sure to please City traditionalists, with the sky blue socks featuring a maroon band around the calves. City's new home shirt appears to have been linked (Photo: www.footyheadlines.com) The dark blue sleeves of this season appear to have been scrapped (Photo: REUTERS) 
Maroon on the socks was first introduced in 1962 but was a feature of the successful 1960s teams, and made a brief comeback in 2010. 
They will also return to more traditional white shorts in the kit, which is due to be launched during the US summer tour. 
The sleeves will also feature Nexen Tires' logo on the sleeves after City became the first Premier League club to sign a sponsorship deal for that part of the shirt. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
